features: Easy to Clean: 6.5-inch and 5-inch Cast Iron flat cooking plates are nonstick and easy to clean with a damp cloth or non abrasive sponge
Adjustable Temperature: Quickly reach and sustain the desired LOW, MEDIUM or HIGH heat settings with the variable temperature knob to keep food warm or boil hot water.
Built in Safety: Dual power indicator lights on the front of the burner remind users when the item is powered ON; non skid feet ensure the burner remains stable during use.
Compact and portable: the compact size of the burner makes it an easily accessible item to take on the go wherever an extra cooking device is needed, at school, office, camping trips or home.
Efficient Power - With a combined wattage of 1500W, dual hot plates and individual temperature controls, delicious meals can be cooked simultaneously.
body.description: Cooking is quick, easy and consistent with the Elite Gourmet Electric Double Buffet Burner. This portable electric hot plate offers reliable heating and takes up minimal cooking space with one 6.5-inch and one 6-inch cast iron flat cooking plates. At 1,500 watts, it heats up quickly with dual adjustable temperature knobs offering Low, Med, and Hi settings. Power indicator lights offer added safety. The non-stick cast iron hot plates will ensure even cooking and make clean up a breeze. Use it when you need an extra heat source for holiday cooking and entertaining, or simply to keep food warm at a buffet station. The perfect addition to any cooks collection, it is compact enough to be stored in a cabinet, yet stylish enough to leave out for everyday use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Unbelievably great addition to my life!
reviews.reviewText: I got two of these burners (2burners on each) after I tried the first one out and loved it. The reason I got it to begin with is that I have a very large glass cooktop made by GE which was very difficult to clean. And when our son left home and my husband took over his duties of cleaning countertops and the stove top after dinner, he hated it so much, I began to investigate what alternative methods I could use to cook a meal.I first tried cooking everything in the oven and burned myself badly twice! That’s when I investigated getting a burner that I could plug-in like this one. I love it! Yes, it takes longer to heat up to high but I just add time for that. I have never made better omelettes than using this burner and the reason is I can’t hurry along like I used to try on the stove top and then get it rubbery and overcooked! It cooks eggs absolutely perfectly.And everything else perfectly too. I even used it to boil pasta and it worked out great. I just had to give it extra time to come to a boil. So now I use two of these every evening and in addition, an incredible large electric pot for large meals that I want to simmer. For searing and browning food, I have another very large electric pan, as well, so the only time I’ve had to use my glass cooktop was for Thanksgiving when I was making too many items to use the burners. Cleaning that terrible cooktop twice a year for holidays is not too much for our family!So what you should know about these burners, is that they work perfectly, but you will need more time to get it hot to begin with. They are extremely easy to clean and there’s no place for anything to go underneath something that is unreachable. I overboiled some soup and thought that it would be a mess to clean up, but it wasn’t at all! I simply got a sponge and wiped it off. I can’t think of a single thing that I don’t like about these burners which are so incredibly reasonably priced. I hope if you get them that you enjoy them as much as I do!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comparable to electric stovetops!
reviews.reviewText: My partner and I got this as a temporary solution while we're renovating our house and this has been a great replacement for an electric stove! Functions basically the same and it heats things up just like a regular stovetop. My only critic is that the heat settings are a little hard to get used to and it takes a while to heat up but all in all, I don't know what we would've done without it in the meantime!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price
reviews.reviewText: I bought this in order to cook in my room as most of the house I'm staying in is shared space and my job keeps me up at odd hours. Honestly it's worth it, but it does have pros and cons.Cons:Chassis is just cheap, easily dentable and can be pulled apart easily if you try. So if you don't have a safe area to keep it, it can be destroyed if dropped.The right burner started rusting basically immediately. No amount of immediate clean up or Bleach or other cleaners are helping, it's just slowly rusting.The burners themselves are a little small, if that's something that'll bother you. I cook for one person, but cooking many things or for many people will start causing issues.Pros:It gets pretty hot, I have no issues cooking anything I need.While the Chassis feels cheap, the burners are built fine and I don't have any safety issues using them.1500 total watts, one burner is 900 and one is 600, so if you're worried about flipping any breakers you can adjust which side you use.A good purchase for the price, something for college students or camping gear if you expect to have power.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works just like a 2 burner built in stovetop.
reviews.reviewText: My built in cooktop died, and repairing it is gonna be costly, so I picked this up to have something in the interim. I've been using it every day since it arrived (about 3 1/2 months, now). I can cook on both burners at once, and boil on both. Time to boil is good, and the thermostat seems to keep a pretty steady temp.There are a couple of minor drawbacks.The burners are ridged. While this doesn't (as far as I can see) adversely affect cooking, it does make them more difficult to clean. Wiping them with paper towels gets you paper fuzz rubbed off the towels and left behind on the burners. Same with sponges.There are no shields or guards over the knobs, so if you're simmering or something spills, whatever hits the body of the housing can just run down the side and get behind the knobs. They stand clear from the body, so you CAN get back there to clean, but it's kind of a pain.Other than the cleaning issues, which are minor, I'm completely happy with the unit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A real kitchen asset - long term review 1 year - recommended!
reviews.reviewText: After a year of using one of these as the only cooking appliance for a family of foodies, I can say it is an excellent choice. Good and bad follows, mostly good.This thing is great for what it is, and what it does. Just bought a second unit to have 4 burner ability...OK, up front - some are defective, if you get one with issues, just return it.(Hey, it costs about one pizza, delivered, after all!)It is a 1500 watt cooktop, reasonably priced, with cast iron burners. The 1500 watts means a bit slower heating than an 1800 watt unit - but if you are in a place where you can't put it on its own 20 amp circuit breaker, you stand a better chance of actually using it. Divided into 900 and 600 watts means left side is nearly a thousand watt cooktop, right side is 20% hotter than a 500 watt cooktop. Good compromise.It gets hot, it controls the temperature reasonably well for what it is. Coil cooktops are notorious for boiling over or just sitting there, cast iron mellows out the temperature fluctuations. Countertop doesn't get too hot, and we've used much larger pans than the size of the burners - though if pushed to the ridiculous, the outer edges of a big frying pan might not be quite warm enough. To be expected.We've prepared just about everything under the sun on these things - and it's more economical and generates less humidity in the house than a gas stove - efficient with all pots and pans, not just the ones that are induction capable - and just as efficient - the only thing I can say is "well done"...Small, easy to transport, good for travel, too.Recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars it did keep things warm
reviews.reviewText: It did not get hot enough to cook or boil water otherwise it was controllable to keep things warm

This thing works great for the price. Sure it takes longer to heat then a fill sized stove/oven range but it runs on 110 volt vs 220 volt so that is to be expected. Yes, some of the reviews say there isn't a tonne of room but all the information is there, and there are always options to pay more for larger ones. This works perfect and fast enough for my morning eggs.

The media could not be loaded. The product I received was making a rattling sound as I opened it. Further there were 2 dents on its body. It's body is not made up of any sturdy material and doesn't seem it would have lasted for long by any means. Had to return it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Heats up pretty well. Will use for camping.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. It’s not a scientific study, but I put 2 cups of cold tap water in the little pot with a lid and turned the smaller burner to Max. It started heating up within a couple of minutes. Full boil at over 200 degrees F by the 10 minute mark as shown on the video. I think it will be fine for coffee, drinks and boiling eggs or soup. I didn’t put both burners to use at the same time except to follow the instructions to put them on at Level 1 for 15 minutes to burn off the initial smell. The smell wasn’t too bad. The whole unit does get very hot so be careful ( not safe around young children). The burners have fine grooves so are harder to clean and you need to wait a while for them to cool down before you can wipe them down. Still, for a camping stove (at an electrical site) or maybe a dorm room, it works fine for the low price. Looking forward to use it for our winter camping trip in February!

I used to have the stove with electric coil thinggies and I could never get them to stay perfectly flat, so my pots fell twice on the floor mid-cooking. This is when I decided to get this model instead and im so happy I did. The cast iron plates are perfectly flat and now I can leave stuff on it to cook unattended while I do other stuff around the house. The iron cast surface is a bit bigger then the electic burners of simiar size stoves, heat is well evenly distributed and I am not restricted on what kind of pots to use like convection stove options. It is very easy to clean, light-weight, takes very little space and the rubber legs keep stove safely in place. Temperature controls work well, temp is increasing/dicreasing accordingly. It is of great quality and I find it very affordable. I would not want a fancier one, this fits all my needs and expectations. Even funner for me is that I can take it with me camping summers. I'm definitely getting my money worth with this baby.

As I was removing this lightweight cheap item from the box, my thumb dented in the middle of the cooktop and I’m not big or strong. The metal bends easily to finger pressure everywhere and also highlighting the label wore off within a week (not that the label matters but it’s the poor quality). The bottom legs also left marks all over my rental counters and after scrubbing I got them pretty light but even the magic eraser did not remove what’s left. Will be returning. We have had it less Han a month and it’s breaking. The heat intervals are also not accurate for easy cooking, constantly adjusting them to keep my food cooking at the temp I need. And it takes over 15 minutes with hot tap water to boil. My foods take way too long on here it just can’t get hot enough. My old cooktop boiled water in 5 minutes so the technology exists but not in this poorly built item
